steps.text: Clean the new external composite surface with approved cleaner to remove all mold release materials.
Use 3M™ Perfect-It™ Boat Wash and 3M™ Perfect-It™ High Performance Cloth for cleaning.
Sand the old or new gelcoat using a DA sander with 3M Hookit 775L Cubitron II abrasive discs, grade 80+.
Apply dry guide coat to the surface and re-sand for an even texture.
Clean the repair area with approved cleaner or blow off using pressured air.
Mix 3M™ Marine Blister Repair Filler and apply to fill 85% of the cavity.
Wait 30 minutes.
Feather the repair with a 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron™ II abrasive disc, grade 80+.
Apply dry guide coat and re-sand the area.
Mix 3M™ Marine Premium Filler and apply with a tight coat.
Let the filler cure and then sand with 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron™ II grade 120+ abrasive discs.
Apply 3M™ Marine Blister Repair Filler (if needed).
Sand the repair area with 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron²² TM II grade 220+.
Use a 3M™ Sander for sanding.
Ensure the surface is completely dry.
Mask areas with 3M™ Precision Masking Tape.
Back up the masked areas with 3M™ Performance Industrial Masking Tape or 3M Scotch® Performance Masking Tape.
Mask the entire surface with 3M™ Purple Premium Plus Masking Film.
Mix gelcoat in a 3M™ PPS™ Series 2.0 disposable spray cup.
Remove filter in the lid of the 3M™ PPS™ Series 2.0 disposable spray cup.
Adjust settings on the 3M™ Performance Spray Gun.
Hold spray gun 15cm-20cm from the surface and apply gelcoat.
Use 3M™ Performance Spray Gun, 3M™ Performance Gravity HVLP Atomising Head, and 3M™ PPS™ Series 2.0 Spray Cup System.
Clean the new external composite surface with approved cleaner.
Sand the surface to remove any imperfections.
Apply a thin coat of gelcoat using a roller or brush.
Allow the gelcoat to cure for the recommended time.
Sand the cured gelcoat with fine-grit sandpaper.
Apply a clear coat to protect the finished surface.
Sand with 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron™ II 320+ grade abrasive.
Sand with 400+ grade abrasive.
Check surface condition and sand with P800 grade abrasive if needed.
Refine the P800 grade sand scratch using P1200 grade 3M™ Hookit™ Flexible Abrasive Foam Discs.
Compound the surface with 3M™ Perfect-It™ Gelcoat Heavy Cutting Compound and a 3M™ Perfect-It™ Low Linting Wool Compounding Pad using a Rotary Polishing machine at 1400-1800 rpm.
Polish with 3M™ Perfect-It™ Gelcoat Compound + Polish and a wool compounding pad at 1400-1800 rpm.
Apply 3M™ Perfect-It™ Boat Wax to a 10cm x 10cm area and wipe clean before it dries.
Clean the surface.
Sand the surface.
Refine sand scratches.
Clean the surface with an approved cleaner.
Sand the surface using a DA sander and 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron™ II 80+ grade abrasive discs.
Compound the surface with 3M™ Perfect-It™ Gelcoat Compound + Polish and a 3M™ Perfect-It™ Low Linting Wool Compounding Pad.
Use a Rotary Polishing machine at 1400-1800 rpm.
Protect the surface (same as 6-step process).
Clean the surface after.
Filler application: Apply 3M™ Marine Premium Filler.
Let filler set and apply dry guide coat.
Sand with 120+ grade after dry guide coat.
Finish sanding with 220+ grade.
Clean the surface.
Masking: Ensure the surface is dry and apply masking tapes and film as described.
Primer Application: Mix primer in a 3M™ PPS™ Series 2.0 cup and apply with a 3M™ Performance Spray Gun held 15cm-20cm from the surface.
Primer Sanding: Apply dry guide coat and sand the primer with 320+ grade abrasive discs, then repeat with 400+ grade.
Clean the surface.
Marine paint Application: Mix paint in a 3M™ PPS™ Series 2.0 cup and apply with a 3M™ Performance Spray Gun.
Clean the surface with approved cleaner.
Marine Paint application.
Sand with a DA sander and soft interface pad using 3M Hookit Purple Finishing Film Disc (260L+, P1200/1500 grade) for dry sanding.
For wet sanding, use 3M Trizact Hookit Clear Coat Sanding Disc (grade 1500) instead and apply a light mist of water.
Refine P1200 scratches with 3M™ Hookit™ Flexible Abrasive Foam Disc P2000 grade.
Refine P1500 scratches with 3M™ Trizact™ Hookit™ Foam Abrasive Disc 443SA grade 3000.
Use a light mist of water when refining P1500 scratches.
Clean the surface before compounding.
Clean the surface with an approved cleaner.
Compound with 3M™ Perfect-It™ Fast Cut Plus Extreme and a 3M™ wool or green foam compounding pad using a rotary polisher at 1400-1800 rpm.
Polish the surface with 3M™ Perfect-It™ Ultrafina SE Polish and a 3M™ wool or blue foam polishing pad at 1400-1800 rpm.
Apply 3M™ Perfect-It™ Boat Wax to a 10cm x 10cm area and wipe clean before it dries.
Sand the bottom surface using a dual-action sander with 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron² II 220+ grade abrasive.
Clean the area after sanding.
Mix and apply 3M™ Marine Premium Filler.
Let the filler cure.
Sand the filled area with 120+ grade abrasive.
Finish sanding with 220+ grade abrasive.
Apply masking tapes and film.
Mix bottom paint in a 3M™ PPS™ Series 2.0 cup.
Use a 3M™ Performance Spray Gun to apply the mixed paint.
Hold the spray gun 15cm-20cm from the surface.
Products are not intended for consumer use unless specifically stated.
Use products in compliance with health and safety regulations.
Consult a safety professional for assistance.
Contact 3M for information.

constraints.text: Ensure the surface is dry before applying masking tapes and film.
The customer is responsible for evaluating product suitability, conducting a workplace hazard assessment, following regulations, and using appropriate safety equipment.
